page.title: 01Burgh-Le-Marsh
page.content: The district is predominantly flat & low lying. The land is intensively cultivated. In this decade much of the traditional field pattern has gone to be replaced by large open fields. A small area of Burgh Common remains as pasture land with high protective hedges. The land is mainly in the hands of small family farms. Bugh-Le-Marsh, an ancient settlement stands on an area of high ground rising dramatically from the surrounding marshland. It dominates the area physically and as a centre for shopping and social life. It is mainly a dormitory settlement with modern bungalow estates on the outskirts housing visited prople from midland towns. Nevertheless there is a strong community sprit. The village Hall and Recreation Centre (formerly the Victorian school) are fully used
